title: Font used by "It's Nice That"
content:
Hi everyone,

Can anybody help me to find this font ?  
It's used here : [http://www.itsnicethat.com/articles/student-of-the-month-september-call-...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150404131102/http:/www.itsnicethat.com/articles/student-of-the-month-september-call-for-submissions "http://www.itsnicethat.com/articles/student-of-the-month-september-call-for-submissions")

Thanks in advance !

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150404131102im_/http:/typophile.com/files/submissions-big_3670.jpeg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [submissions-big.jpeg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150404131102/http:/typophile.com/files/submissions-big_0.jpeg) | 26.27 KB |
author: Alphonse

comments.content:
I'm pretty convinced this is set using the latin counterpart of some font for foreign languages (may be chinese?). Oriya MN or Myanmar MN latin part have such design.  
Previous discussions: [http://typophile.com/node/101036](http://web.archive.org/web/20150404131102/http:/typophile.com/node/101036 "http://typophile.com/node/101036"), [http://www.typophile.com/node/98738](http://web.archive.org/web/20150404131102/http:/www.typophile.com/node/98738 "http://www.typophile.com/node/98738"), [http://w.typophile.com/node/94585](http://web.archive.org/web/20150404131102/http:/w.typophile.com/node/94585 "http://w.typophile.com/node/94585")
Looks to me like it's Times New Roman with the serifs lopped off, and a few other modifications.

Agree with you Mark, especially for lowercases. May be they've started from Times New Roman to create this latin counterpart... Here's what I've managed to get using Oriya MN, definitely matching to me.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150404131102im_/http:/typophile.com/files/cfs_5018.png)

Great ! Oriya MN works perfectly.  
Merci beaucoup !
